From Peru to the Vatican, the rise of 'Monseñor Roberto de Chiclayo,' now Leo XIV
subhead: Francis's successor at the Vatican lived for many years in the South American country. Le Monde traveled to the city of Chiclayo to meet with several people who remember the days when he was still known as Robert Prevost.

headline: Iconic cauldron from Paris Olympic Games returns to light up summer nights
subhead: The 30-meter-tall floating ring first dazzled during the 2024 Paris Olympics. The cauldron's return is part of French President Emmanuel Macron's effort to preserve the Games' spirit in the city.

headline: Historian Vincent Duclert: 'Focusing on whether genocide is taking place in Gaza is counterproductive'
subhead: Questioned on May 13 on how to describe the violence in Gaza, French President Emmanuel Macron said it was for historians to say. But are they able to decide? Vincent Duclert, a renowned expert on the genocide of Tutsis in Rwanda, reflects on the mutual contributions of historians and law experts.

headline: 'A furnace': Life under Paris's zinc roofs during a heatwave
subhead: On Saturday, the French capital faced a heatwave, with temperatures reaching up to 36°C. The residents of the city's 'chambres de bonne,' small top-floor flats, struggled to cope.

subhead: The American superstar performed the first of three concerts at the arena in Saint-Denis on Thursday. The show centered on tracks from her latest album, Cowboy Carter.
